messages.title: Working across the Stone constituency
messages.content:
We cannot simply stand by and watch a Conservative Government get re-elected for another 5 years. This General Election is about what kind of a society we want in Britain.

I am fighting for social justice - where our economy serves the many and not an elite few, where our society protects the weakest and poorest amongst us, and where we work and live together, freely, in a community that helps us all realise our true potential.

Please vote Labour on Thursday 7 May.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Increase the minimum wage to £8 an hour by 2020

Cut tuition fees from £9000 a year to £6000. Recruit 20,000 more nurses, 8,000 more GPs, 3,000 more midwives and 5,000 more homecare workers paid for by tackling tax avoidance, a tax on properties over £2m and a tax on tobacco company profits
Abolish the cruel, costly and failing Bedroom Tax
Provide 25 hours of free childcare a week for working parents with three and four-year-olds

issues.economy: Tackling tax avoidance and a tax on properties over £2m.
issues.education: Cut tuition fees from £9000 a year to £6000.
issues.health: Recruit 20,000 more nurses, 8,000 more GPs, 3,000 more midwives and 5,000 more homecare workers.

leaflet.personalStatement: I am fighting for social justice - where our economy serves the many and not an elite few, where our society protects the weakest and poorest amongst us, and where we work and live together, freely, in a community that helps us all realise our true potential.

images.caption: Your Labour Party Parliamentary Candidate for Stone Constituency
